subject: Re: [junit] newbie: Tools to generate junit test (not skeleton)
msgSnippet: ... Urm, maybe I m being dense, but how would a tool know what tests you wanted to generate, and what do the primitive types have to offer? If you re writing
messageBody:
On Tuesday 30 September 2003 14:35, jim_gustafson wrote:
> I was wondering if any of you know of a tool to automatically
> generate JUnit tests. I've looed at JUB in eclipse and the JUnit tool
> in NetBeans, but they just generate the sekleton (methods with no meat).
>
> Does anyone know of a FREE tool that will generate the test method for
> at least primitive types (int, double, float, boolean...)

Urm, maybe I'm being dense, but how would a tool know what tests you
wanted to generate, and what do the primitive types have to offer?

If you're writing code test-first, you write the tests first anyway - how else
would you know what's to go in the class?

If not, how do you explain to the tool what the test cases are? Inferring them
from already-written code is hard (and runs the risk of capturing subtle
incorrect behaviour).

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
